live.description: Alias for @wire. Renders a Kirewire component.

wired.description: Injects the necessary client-side scripts for Wired.

template.description: Standard HTML template element, heavily used by Alpine.js for x-for and x-if directives.

wire:click.description:
Handles click events and calls a component method.

### Modifiers
- `.prevent`: Calls `event.preventDefault()`
- `.stop`: Calls `event.stopPropagation()`
- `.self`: Only triggers if the event was dispatched from this element specifically
- `.outside`: Triggers when clicking outside the element
- `.once`: Only triggers the event once
- `.debounce.Xms`: Debounces the handler (default 150ms)
- `.throttle.Xms`: Throttles the handler

### Example
```html
<button wire:click="increment">Increment</button>
<button wire:click.prevent="save">Save</button>
```

wire:live.description: Alias for wire:model.live. Updates the property in real-time.

wire:defer.description: Alias for wire:model.defer. Updates the property only on action.

wire:model.description:
Two-way data binding for component properties. Syncs the input value with the component state.

### Modifiers
- `.live`: Syncs the value in real-time as the user types (default behavior is usually on 'change' for text inputs)
- `.blur`: Syncs the value when the input loses focus
- `.debounce.Xms`: Delays the sync request by X milliseconds (default 150ms)
- `.throttle.Xms`: Limits the sync request frequency

### Example
```html
<input wire:model="search" type="text" />
<input wire:model.live.debounce.300ms="search" type="text" />
```

wire:submit.description:
Handles form submission events. Automatically prevents default submission if `.prevent` is used.

### Modifiers
- `.prevent`: Calls `event.preventDefault()` (Recommended)

### Example
```html
<form wire:submit.prevent="save">
    ...
</form>
```

wire:keydown.description:
Listens for keydown events on the element. Can be scoped to specific keys.

### Modifiers
- `.enter`, `.escape`, `.tab`, `.space`, `.arrow-right`, etc.: Listen for specific keys
- `.prevent`: Prevent default action
- `.stop`: Stop propagation

### Example
```html
<input wire:keydown.enter="search" />
```

wire:keyup.description:
Listens for keyup events.

### Example
```html
<input wire:keyup.escape="cancel" />
```

wire:mouseenter.description: Triggers action when mouse enters the element.

wire:mouseleave.description: Triggers action when mouse leaves the element.

wire:init.description:
Runs an action immediately after the component initializes and renders in the DOM. Useful for lazy loading data or triggering client-side setup. ### Example ```html
Loading...
```

wire:loading.description:
Toggles visibility or classes while a network request is pending. By default, it hides the element until a request starts, then shows it. ### Modifiers - `.class`: Adds a class instead of toggling visibility - `.attr`: Adds an attribute (e.g. `disabled`) instead of toggling visibility - `.remove`: Opposite behavior: Shows by default, hides during loading - `.flex`, `.grid`, `.block`, `.inline`: Sets the display type when showing - `.delay`: Delays showing the loading state (default 200ms) to avoid flickering - `.delay.shortest`, `.delay.shorter`, `.delay.short`, `.delay.long`, `.delay.longer`, `.delay.longest`: Predefined delay durations ### Example ```html Loading...
Content
```

wire:target.description: Scopes `wire:loading` indicators to a specific method or model update. The loading state will only trigger when the specified action is being performed. ### Example ```html Saving... ```

wire:poll.description:
Polls the server at a specified interval to refresh the component. ### Modifiers - `.Xms`: Poll every X milliseconds (e.g. `.2000ms`) - `.Xs`: Poll every X seconds - `.keep-alive`: Keep polling even if the tab is in the background - `.visible`: Only poll when the element is visible in the viewport ### Example ```html
Current Time: {{ now }}
```

wire:ignore.description:
Tells Kirewire to ignore this element and its children during DOM updates. Useful for integrating third-party libraries (like Charts, Maps, Datepickers) that modify the DOM. ### Modifiers - `.self`: Only ignore the element itself, not its children (rarely used) ### Example ```html
```

wire:id.description: Internal ID of the component instance (auto-generated). Usually you do not need to touch this.

wire:navigate.description: Enables SPA-like navigation for links. When clicked, Kirewire fetches the page in the background and swaps the body content without a full page reload. ### Modifiers - `.hover`: Prefetch the page when hovering over the link ### Example ```html Profile ```

wire:confirm.description:
Prompts the user for confirmation before performing an action.
Uses the native browser `confirm()` dialog.

### Example
```html
<button wire:click="delete" wire:confirm="Are you sure you want to delete this?">
    Delete
</button>
```

wire:stream.description: Enables streaming updates for this element (if supported by the backend response).

wire:offline.description:
Toggles visibility or classes when the browser goes offline. ### Modifiers - `.class`: Adds a class when offline - `.attr`: Adds an attribute when offline - `.remove`: Hides when offline ### Example ```html
You are currently offline.
```

wire:dirty.description: Toggles visibility or classes when the component state is "dirty" (unsaved changes). Usually used with `wire:model`. ### Modifiers - `.class`: Adds a class when dirty - `.attr`: Adds an attribute when dirty - `.remove`: Hides when dirty ### Example ```html Unsaved changes... ```

x-data.description: Declares a new Alpine component scope.

x-init.description: Runs code when an element is initialized.

x-show.description: Toggles the visibility of an element.

x-bind.description: Sets the value of an attribute.

x-on.description: Attaches an event listener to the element.

x-text.description: Updates the text content of an element.

x-html.description: Updates the inner HTML of an element.

x-model.description: Adds two-way data binding to an element.

x-for.description: Iterates over an array or object. Must be used on a <template> tag.

x-transition.description: Applies enter and leave transitions to an element.

x-effect.description: Executes a script each time one of its dependencies changes.

x-ignore.description: Prevents Alpine from initializing attributes within the element.

x-ref.description: References an element directly by name.

x-cloak.description: Hides the element until Alpine has initialized.

x-teleport.description: Teleports the element to another part of the DOM.

x-if.description: Conditionally renders an element. Must be used on a <template> tag.

x-id.description: Generates a unique ID for accessible elements.

types.comment: Iterates over an array or object.
